text.tspan: Marketing Intelligence
Sales Intelligence
Marketing intelligence is typically information
pertinent to market size, population, infrastructure,
location, and consumer spending habits.
This can help marketers and decision-makers
choose the right kind of regions or markets they
can enter next, be informed about what
consumers expect, and make growth projections
for specific markets.
Sales intelligence, as we saw earlier, refers to the
information & insights about prospective buyers
that companies can benefit from. This can include
technographics, psychographics, firmographics,
buyer intent, and other related knowledge.
Marketing intelligence predominantly helps in
making marketing decisions, but as a corollary,
they impact lead quality and lead volume which
will affect the sales team.
Sales intelligence helps client-facing teams like
sales organizations and customer success
functions perform better. They can also help
product teams understand exactly what clients
expect from their software.
While marketing intelligence mostly revolves
around market research and marketing spend
optimization, it rarely delves into account-based
information.
It rather focuses on gaining insights about
industry trends and market development metrics
to aid a companyâ€™s go-to-market strategy
Sales intelligence is often account-based, and
gives users access to deep insights about the
AIOs and purchase intent of buyers.
